text.0: forth from the darkness in the region eastward this most abundant splendid light hatb mounted.
text.1: now verily the farrefulgent mornings daughters of heaven bring welfare to the people.
text.2: the richlycoloured dawns have mounted eastward like pillars planted at our sacrifices.
text.3: and flushing far splendid and purifying unbarred the portals of the fold of darkness.
text.4: dispelling gloom this day the wealthy mornings urge liberal givers to present their treasures.
text.5: in the unlightened depth of darkness round them let niggard traffickers sleep unawakened.
text.6: o goddesses is this your car i ask you ancient this day or is it new ye mornings.
text.7: wherewith rich dawns ye seek with wealth navagva daśagva aṅgira the seventoned singer.
text.8: with horses harnessed by eternal order goddesses swiftly round the worlds ye travel.
text.9: arousing from their rest o dawns the sleeping and all that lives man bird and beast to motion.
text.10: which among these is eldest and where is she through whom they fixed the Ṛbhus regulations.
text.11: what time the splendid dawns go forth for splendour they are not known apart alike unwasting.
text.12: blest were these dawns of old shining with succour true with the truth that springs from holy order.
text.13: with whom the toiling worshipper by praises hymning and lauding soon attained to riches.
text.14: hither from eastward all at once they travel from one place spreading in the selfsame manner.
text.15: awaking from the seat of holy order the godlike dawns come nigh like troops of cattle.
text.16: thus they go forth with undiminished colours these mornings similar in selfsame fashion.
text.17: concealing the gigantic might of darkness with radiant bodies bright and pure and shining.
text.18: o goddesses o heavens refulgent daughters bestow upon us wealth with store of children.
text.19: as from our pleasant place of rest ye rouse us may we be masters of heroic vigour.
text.20: wellskilled in lore of sacrifice ye daughters of heaven refulgent dawns i thus address you.
text.21: may we be glorious among the people may heaven vouchsafe us this and earth the goddess.
